page.title: 02LYTHAM HALL & CLIFTON FAMILY
page.content: For generations Lytham Hall belonged to the Cliftons.On the 31st.May 1963. G.R.E.bought 1700 acres of it from Mr. Henry Talbot Clifton.The hall,later purchased on 2nd.February 1966 it cost Â£1,350,000.The land is called "Home farm" and is owned by British Field Products but is tenented by G.R.E.Farms.The estate is used for farming and some residential and industrial use. The Hall itself was used to accommodate staff until new office buildings in Ballam Road were ready,whilst part of the house is still used as the estate office. Henry Clifton died,1979,in Brighton,he was 72 and died virtually penniless leaving Â£30,000.The Cliftons fought a legal battle and won.People have seen a tall,dark figure many times said to be John Clifton.
